treeclimbR 0.1.1
  • Reference

calculates number of cells per cluster-sample combination.

calcTreeCounts.Rd

calcTreeCounts calculates number of cells per cluster-sample combination (referred to as cluster cell 'counts', 'abundances', or 'frequencies'). This is a tree version of calcCounts. The clusters used in calcCounts are clusters on the leaf level of the tree here. More details about the data could be found in calcCounts.

calcTreeCounts(d_se, tree)

Arguments

d_se

Data object from previous steps, in TreeSummarizedExperiment format, containing cluster labels as a column in the row meta-data (from generateClusters). Column meta-data is assumed to contain a factor marker_class.
tree

A phylo object from buildTree

Value

A TreeSummarizedExperiment object, where clusters in rows, samples in columns and counts in assays

Author

Ruizhu Huang

Examples

# For a complete workflow example demonstrating each step, please see the
# vignette of 'diffcyt'
library(diffcyt)

# Function to create random data (one sample)
d_random <- function(n = 20000, mean = 0, sd = 1, ncol = 20, cofactor = 5) {
    d <- sinh(matrix(rnorm(n, mean, sd), ncol = ncol)) * cofactor
    colnames(d) <- paste0("marker", sprintf("%02d", 1:ncol))
    d
}

# Create random data (without differential signal)
set.seed(123)
d_input <- list(
    sample1 = d_random(), 
    sample2 = d_random(), 
    sample3 = d_random(), 
    sample4 = d_random()
)

experiment_info <- data.frame(
    sample_id = factor(paste0("sample", 1:4)), 
    group_id = factor(c("group1", "group1", "group2", "group2")), 
    stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)

marker_info <- data.frame(
    channel_name = paste0("channel", sprintf("%03d", 1:20)), 
    marker_name = paste0("marker", sprintf("%02d", 1:20)), 
    marker_class = factor(c(rep("type", 10), rep("state", 10)), 
                          levels = c("type", "state", "none")), 
    stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)

# Prepare data
d_se <- prepareData(d_input, experiment_info, marker_info)

# Transform data
d_se <- transformData(d_se)

# Generate clusters
d_se <- generateClusters(d_se)
#> FlowSOM clustering completed in 0.4 seconds

# build a tree
tr <- buildTree(d_se)
#> Error in addLabel(tree_p): could not find function "addLabel"

# calculate medians on nodes of a tree
d_medians_tree <- calcTreeCounts(d_se = d_se, tree = tr)
#> Error in is(tree, "phylo"): object 'tr' not found
